pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.1.1: At one time the Master was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.1.2: At that time Venerable Nanda, the Master’s cousin, was handsome and graceful. He was 8 centimeters shorter than the Master,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.1.3: but he wore a robe that was the same size as the Buddha’s.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.1.4: When the senior monks saw him coming,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.1.6: they thought it was the Master and got up from their seats.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.1.7: But when he came close, they realized who it was, and they complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.1.8: “How can Venerable Nanda wear a robe the same size as the Master’s?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.1.9: “Is it true, Nanda, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.1.12: Nanda, how can you wear a robe the same size as mine?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.1.13: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.1.14: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.1.15: ‘If a monk gets a robe made which is the standard robe measure or larger, it is to be cut down, and he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.1.16: This is the standard robe measure: 2.25 meters long and 1.5 meters wide.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a complete Order through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.10: if he makes one or gets one made, then the effort constitutes wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.11: When he obtains it, it is to be cut down, and he is then to confess an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.12: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.13: If he gets others to finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.14: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.15: If he gets others to finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.16: If he makes one or gets one made for the benefit of someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.17: If he obtains one that was made by someone else and then uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.3: The tenth rule, the training rule on Nanda, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.4: The ninth sub-chapter on precious things is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.10: “Venerables, the ninety-two rules entailing confession have been recited.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.11: In regard to this I ask you,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.17: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I will remember it thus.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.18: The section on minor rules has been completed.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.19: The chapter on offenses entailing confession is finished.
